todos.title: Surface v. Deep Propositions
todos.body: Surface propositions are the perceivable and physical elements of a design, deep propositions are the underlying meaning of those elements.  Example Obama logo has a lot of hidden meaning which makes it a good logo.

todos.title: Hierarchy
todos.body: Simplest structure for visualizing and understanding complexity.  Can be done with tree structures, nest structures, and stair structures.

todos.title: NIH
todos.body: Not invented here.  Groups reject products not invented where they are from.

todos.title: Others
todos.body: Mapping, Mental Model, Proximity, Readability, Serial Position, Similarity, Storytelling, Symmetry,

todos.title: Mnemonic Device
todos.body: Making it easier to remember something through first letters, keyword, rhyme, or imagery.

todos.title: Waba Sabi
todos.body: Impermanence, imperfection, and incompleteness.  It is not sloppy but embodies imperfection and nature to achieve a deeper, more meaningful view.

todos.title: Freeze–Flight-Fight-Forfeit
todos.body: Four responses to acute stress in humans.
Eighty percent of product usage involves twenty percent of features.

todos.title: Pen & Paper
todos.body: Always start designs with a pen a paper.  Go through multiple iterations before you put it on the screen.

todos.title: Size of Committee
todos.body: Working groups should be three members and boards should be seven to twelve.

todos.title: Red Effect
todos.body: Women wearing red are more attractive and men wearing red are more dominant.

todos.title: Framing
todos.body: Use of words to manipulate how people think.  Ex the glass is half full v half empty.

todos.title: Orientation sensitivity
todos.body: thirty degrees is the minimally noticed angle for humans.

todos.title: Scarcity
todos.body: Things are desirable when there is exclusive information, limited access, limited time, limited number, suddenness.

todos.title: Weakest Link
todos.body: The weakest element will fail in order to protect the other elements in the system.

todos.title: Factor of Safety
todos.body: The use of elements beyond what is thought necessary to offset unknown facts and prevent system failure.

todos.title: Hick’s Law
todos.body: The time it takes to make a decision increases as the number of alternatives increases.

todos.title: Face-ism Ratio
todos.body: The more face to body that is shown in a picture, the more intellectual the person will look, the more body to face in a picture resembles sensual and physical attributes of the person.

todos.title: Satisficing
todos.body: The best decisions are not always those that perfectly satisfy the optimal design but roughly satisfy it.

todos.title: Veblen Effect
todos.body: Tendency to find a product desirable because it has a high price.

todos.title: Convergence
todos.body: Similar characteristics and will evolve from independent systems in nature.  Ex hanglider design closely resembles a soaring bird or flying squirrel.

todos.title: Nudging
todos.body: Setting intelligent defaults to nudge user to the intended behavior.  They have to take action to opt out.

todos.title: Fibonacci Sequence
todos.body: Sequence of numbers, which the next is the sum of the preceding two.  Creates aesthetic designs..

todos.title: Exposure Effect
todos.body: Repeated exposure to something which people have a neutral feeling with increase their likeability of the item.

todos.title: Signal-to-Noise Ratio
todos.body: Removing unnecessary elements.

todos.title: Picture Superiority
todos.body: Pictures are remembered more than words.

todos.title: Baby Face Bias
todos.body: People with baby faces are seen as more naïve, helpless, and honest.  Use mature faces when expressing authority and expertise.

todos.title: Sunk Cost
todos.body: People who invest time into something will continue to use the product even if it doesn’t make sense anymore.  Ex Aol free memberships got people to use the product and then they continued because they had already invested in it.

todos.title: Savanna Preference
todos.body: People prefer open areas and some white space to dense areas or too much whitespace.

todos.title: Most Average Facial Appearance Effect
todos.body: People prefer faces which are closest to their cultures average.

todos.title: Prospect-Refuge
todos.body: People prefer an environment where there are good sightlines to see the surroundings but also areas of concealment and retreat.  See and be seen without seeing or being seen.

todos.title: Threat Detection
todos.body: People notice things and pay greater attention when they detect a threat.  Fear mongering.

todos.title: Entry Points
todos.body: People judge a book by its cover and an internet site by its first page.  Entry points should have minimal barriers and progressive lures to draw people in.

todos.title: Golden Ration
todos.body: Natural ratio of 0.618.

todos.title: Maya
todos.body: Most advanced yet acceptable design.  People want designs to be cutting edge but not so abstract or unique that they become estranged.

todos.title: Progressive Disclosure
todos.body: Managing complexity by only showing necessary information and revealing more information as the user progresses forward.  Ex one search feature on Google with shopping, images, web options on next page.

todos.title: Consistency
todos.body: Makes it more aesthetic for user.

todos.title: Gutenburg diagram
todos.body: Main optical area for left to right readers is top left then bottom right, then top right, then bottom left.

todos.title: Constraint
todos.body: Limiting the actions of the user to improve system performance.

todos.title: Control
todos.body: Level of control of a system should be adaptable to user’s expertise.

todos.title: Three dimensional projection
todos.body: Inferred by overlapping, size difference, elevation, linear perspective, texture gradient, shading, atmospheric perspective.  Use top down lighting versus uplighting.  Don’t make fake humans look too real.

todos.title: Forgiveness
todos.body: Includes good affordances, constraints, safety nets, reversibility, undo-ability, confirmation of action, warnings, help.

todos.title: Hunter v Nurturer
todos.body: Hunter (male) is object oriented, tools, fighting, predators, physical play.  Nurturer (female) is form and colors, facial expressions, nurturing, babies, verbal play.

todos.title: Anthropomorphic Form
todos.body: Humans perceive certain patterns as humanlike and will be drawn to them.  Use feminine forms to elicit associations of sexuality and vitality, round forms for baby like associations, and angular forms for masculine/aggressive associations.

todos.title: Cost Benefit
todos.body: How many steps is user willing to take to accomplish the action.

todos.title: Visuospatial Resonance
todos.body: High spatial frequency images have strong crisp edges with little detail between.  They are easy to see up close but hard to comprehend from a distance.  Low spatial frequency images have blurry edges with lots of detail in between.  They are hard to comprehend up close but easy to comprehend from a distance.

todos.title: Cathedral Effect
todos.body: High ceilings promote abstract thinking and creativity, low ceilings promote detail oriented thinking.

todos.title: Depth of Processing
todos.body: Having to think hard about information will improve the likelihood of being able to recall it.

todos.title: Expectation Effect
todos.body: Greatly influences perception and behavior.

todos.title: Stickiness
todos.body: Getting an idea to stick by simplicity, surprise, concreteness, credibility, emotion, story.

todos.title: Hierarchy of Needs
todos.body: Functionality, reliability, usability, proficiency, and creativity.

todos.title: Five Hat Racks
todos.body: Five ways to organize information are category, time, location, alphabet, and continuum (highest to lowest, best to worst).

todos.title: Horror Vacui
todos.body: Fear of emptiness.  The more white space the more high end the product appears.

todos.title: Scaling Fallacy
todos.body: Error in assuming that a system that works on one scale will work on another scale.

todos.title: Biophilia Effect
todos.body: Environments rich in nature reduce stress and enhance focus and concentration.

todos.title: Figure-Ground Relationship
todos.body: Elements are perceived as ether figures (objects of focus) or ground (rest of perceptual field).  When the composition is clearly distinguished, the relationship is stable and the figure will be better remembered.

todos.title: Rule of Thirds
todos.body: Dividing a medium into thirds creates greater aesthetics.

todos.title: Design by Committee
todos.body: Design by dictator is preferred for time-driven projects with straightforward requirements, consequences of error are tolerable, and stakeholder buy-in is unimportant.  Design by committee is preferred when projects are quality driven, complex, can be consequential, and buy in is important.

todos.title: Inverted Pyramid
todos.body: Critical information should be presented first.

todos.title: Personas
todos.body: Creation of profiles to help describe your major users.

todos.title: Mimicry
todos.body: Copying familiar products in design.

todos.title: Fitts Laws
todos.body: Control buttons and movable objects should be large and near each other when rapid movements and accuracy are important.

todos.title: Shaping
todos.body: Complex behaviors that are difficult to teach are broken down into subbehaviors and taught one by one.  Salespeople shape by offering a prize to come to their location, providing food and drink, and then showing them how product works.

todos.title: Defensible space
todos.body: Clearly marked territories around property to deter crime.

todos.title: Highlighting
todos.body: Bringing attention to an area.

todos.title: Form Follows Function
todos.body: Beauty results from purity of function with the absence of ornamentation.

todos.title: Attractiveness Bias
todos.body: Attractive people are seen as more intelligent.

todos.title: Archetype
todos.body: Associating products with commonly known myths, stories, or fairytales.  Ex Harley Davidson models brand with the outlaw archetype, Nike with the Greek goddess of victory.

todos.title: Flexibility-Usability
todos.body: As the flexibility of a system increases, the usability decreases.

todos.title: Contour Bias
todos.body: Angular objects grab attention but contour and round objects are better liked.

todos.title: Area Alignment
todos.body: Align objects by their area weight and not by their edges or center.  Align quotes by edge of text, not quotation marks.

todos.title: Aesthetics
todos.body: Aesthetic designs are perceived as easier to use and create a positive relationship with the user.

todos.title: Closure
todos.body: A logo that includes recognizable elements does not have to have complete closed lines to be effective.

todos.title: Colors.  Try to keep the number of colors to five or less.  Use warmer colors for foreground and cooler colors for background.
